feature.name: Sacred Oath: Oath of Fitness (HB)
feature.text:
Paladins who swear the Oath of Fitness dedicate themselves to the pursuit of physical perfection, blending their divine powers with an unshakeable commitment to exercise and a healthy lifestyle. These paladins view physical training as a form of worship, believing that a strong body houses a strong spirit.
Tenets of Fitness:
Workout Daily. Commit to rigorous physical training every day. Your body is a temple; treat it as such.
Inspire Health. Lead by example, encouraging those around you to embrace a lifestyle of fitness and wellbeing.
Stay Hydrated. Always remember the importance of water, both for yourself and your allies.
No Pain, No Gain. Embrace the pain of exercise as a path to greater strength an discipline.
Oath Spells: You gain oath spells at the paladin levels listed.
Oath of Fitness Spells: Paladin Level | Spells 3rd | jump, longstrider 5th | enhance ability, warding wind 9th | haste, mass healing word 13th | freedom of movement, stoneskin 17th | steel wind strike, Bigby's hand
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Iron Grip Challenge (Oath of Fitness (HB))
feature.text:
Immediately after grappling a creature, as a bonus action you challenge the creature to a test of strength. While grappled, the target cannot use its action for anything other than attempting to break free, and you gain resistance to damage from all other sources as long as this grapple is maintained.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Channel Divinity: Titan Bindings (Oath of Fitness (HB))
feature.text:
As an action, you create spectral chains that lash out and attempt to restrain up to two creatures within 15 feet. The targets must succeed on a Strength Saving throw or be restrained for 1 minute.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Aura of Gains (Oath of Fitness (HB))
feature.text:
Starting at 7th level, your vigorous lifestyle benefits those around you. Allies within 10 feet gain advantage on Strength and Dexterity checks. The range of this aura increases to 30 feet at 18th level.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Divine Physique (Oath of Fitness (HB))
feature.text:
At 15th level, your intense training pays off, granting you immunity to disease and poison. As an action, once per long rest, you can recover from a condition affecting you by performing a quick workout.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 12 (Homebrew)

feature.name: Galactic Grippers (Oath of Fitness (HB))
feature.text:
At 20th level, you can channel the might of legendary grapplers. As an action, you can transform into a formidable wrestling avatar, gaining the following benefits for 1 minute:
• You can grapple a creature of any size.
• When you successfully grapple a creature, it takes radiant damage equal to your Paladin level at the start of each of its turns while grappled.
• You gain 10 temporary hit points at the start of your turn.
Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a long rest.
Source: Subclasses That Shouldn't Exist v1 p. 12 (Homebrew)
